elements.title: Paroedura maingoka (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the gecko Paroedura maingoka (pictured) imitates venomous scorpions to discourage predators?

elements.title: Maurice Duplessis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that even though the Legislative Assembly of Quebec ordered a monument of Maurice Duplessis in front of its building, later premiers hid it for 16 years to avoid political tensions?

elements.title: In a Nutshell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after the British premiere of Percy Grainger's suite In a Nutshell, The Daily Telegraph argued that the marimba, then new to the orchestra, sounded inferior to the xylophone?

elements.title: a favorite (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a favorite of Tsar Ivan the Terrible may have killed his own father to prove his loyalty to the tsar?

elements.title: BoysTown (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that BoysTown was reported as having the largest case of child abuse in Australia's history?

elements.title: James Dillon Armstrong (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that James Dillon Armstrong was a Virginia state senator, a delegate to West Virginia's constitutional convention, and a circuit court judge while serving for more than 43 years as a Presbyterian church elder?

elements.title: Amrita Shah (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Amrita Shah found that the introduction of television to India led to more women aspiring to become independent?

elements.title: one of the largest fishing companies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one of the largest fishing companies of New Zealand started as a fish and chip shop?
